DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of HE10 eye drop for the patients with moderate to severe dry eye syndrome.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of HE10 for Dry Eye Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: This study is to compare the efficacy and safety of HE10 and Restasis for patients with moderate to severe dry eye syndrome in multi-center, double-blind, randomized, active comparator-controlled, parallel design, non-inferiority Phase III clinical trial.
DOC.criteria: Corneal staining score of â‰¥2(Oxford grade) Schirmer test score (without anesthesia) < 10 mm/5 min in either eye Tear breakup time is 10 seconds or less Screening both eyes, the corrected visual acuity is 0.2 or more Current or recent patients used dry eye syndrome medications (topical or systemic) that may affect the status The patients with systemic or ocular disorders affected the test result Being treated with systemic steroid History of eyeball surgical operation within 3 months of screening visit Wearing contact lenses within 2 weeks of screening visit Be a use or used punctual plug within 1 month of screening vist Use of cyclosporine eye drop within 3 weeks Pregnancy or Breastfeeding Intraocular pressure > 25 mmHg Abnormal eyelid function : Disorders of the eyelids or eyelashes
